text: Robert Takeo Matsui (September 17, 1941â€“January 1, 2005) was an American Democratic politician. He was the U.S. Representative for the 5th District of California.Biographical Directory of the United States Congress, "Matsui, Robert Takeo (1941-2005)"; retrieved 2012-12-2. He was in office from 1979 until his death. His wife, Doris Matsui, replaced him. Matsui was born in Sacramento, California. He comes from a Japanese-American family. He is Sansei, which means that he is the grandson of people born in Japan who immigrated to the US."Biography of Robert Takeo Matsui (1941-2005)" at California State University, Sacramento ; retrieved 2012-12-2. After the Japanese bombed Pearl Harbor, the Matsui family was interned Tule Lake War Relocation Center in 1942.Official biography, originally published at www.house.gov/matsui, retrieved from www.archive.org on January 9, 2007 At the University of California, Berkeley, Matsui earned a BA in political science in 1963. He graduated from Hastings College of Law in 1966. Matsui was the second Japanese American from the U.S. mainland elected to the US Congress. Also, he was the first Sansei congressman. Matsui died of pneumonia caused by myelodysplastic syndrome on January 1, 2005 at the Walter Reed National Military Medical Center in Bethesda, Maryland at the age of 63. ==References== ==Other websites== * Doris Matsui Category:1941 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:United States representatives from California Category:Deaths from myelodysplastic syndrome Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Politicians from Sacramento, California
